title: Karthus too weak, he needs rework and buffs
body:
I don't play karthus much and heres the reasons why. 

He has no escape, all his kit does dmg wit ha small slow
He has no hard cc meaning he is killed easily 1v1 and in group fights
He does high dmg but this means nothing as he's so squishy that he gets killed before any chance of getting a kill himself
He can't farm as he is always pushed out of lane by any other mid lane.

Reasons why I want him made more viable:

His passive and ult are a good idea, but his other kit, his QWE don't work with them to secure kills.

He needs to be made tankier, more starting health and armour. He needs his Q to stun if you land 2 of them in a row, or his W to stun.  Maybe change his W to a C shape wall around him instead of a straight one (even though its easily walked through.  Anita gets a wall thats not able to be walked through.  Why would riot make earths such a lame champ!?

Make this a priority riot as karthus ult makes people want to play him, but when they get him in game he's fizzes away to nothing.  At the moment he has no early to mid game making it impossible for the game to get to late game where he may impact.

Hi DreadedDrone,

I can see the reasons why you are frustrated with Karthus kit, but I don't quite fully understand why. 

His laning phase is actually quite good due to the fact he has a very easy time farming safely in lane due to the range of his Q and the fact his E's passive refunds mana. This along with a {{item:1056}} is enough to sustain mana for a decent amount of time. Running {{summoner:3}} against bursty mid laners is really useful for keeping him safe in lane, as well as turning trades due to the movement speed slow making your Q easier to hit. {{summoner:12}} Offers you bonus global presence with teleport ganks/cleanups or simply farm up items quicker/have safety and keep pressure in your lane.

{{champion:30}} outranges many champs along with having short cooldown on his q. You always need to be ready to poke the enemy when they have cooldowns because Karthus effectively has nearly none in laning. 

His power in the mid-game comes from your map awareness and communicating with your team to **Help** kill people. (Not necessarily hold for kill-stealing, but using it in a close fight or tower dive scenario in another lane in order to secure the kill without any casualties. Being able to have global presence as well as heavy pushing power/poke in sacrifice for little CC until the late game means you have to make the most of the strengths of his kit as explained above.

His W is a GREAT initiation tool in the late game. (When farming right you'll typically be ahead in levels (as well as due to global kill XP.) Its a huge slow which is great for catching a team that is overextended in conjuction with a good flank/hard initiation followup from your teammates. 

In regards to being a squishy champion, this can definitely be adjusted with buildpath. Rod of ages/Seraphs both give him some  great HP stats/Shields with mana sustain for spell spam. Other common items are Rylais for the AOE slow (which has been buffed for his Area of Effect on E rather recently!) Your role of being able to position in their team and create a zone of pure damage and slows can seperate a team or deal massive damage, which realistically is your role.  Zhonyas even works well here for a flash bait into zhonyas for sustained E damage. Remember, your passive is an amazing ability when positioned right, but if positioned wrong it may come off as near useless without a good opportunity to Ulti. 

{{item:3003}}  Or {{item:3157}}  Or {{item:3027}}  Or {{item:3116}} Or  {{item:3001}}  Are all viable choices and can be picked up situationally. Abyssal/Zhonyas versus heavy burst/damage. Rylais to help CC/Kite and give HP, and either Rod of Ages/Seraphs Embrace as a Mana/Damage/Effective HP item

There are obviously many aspects of Karthus to learn and he is considered a hard champ to master. Give it some time and try some of the tips. If you've got any further questions I'd be happy to try and help.

He's not designed to escape, and really? His slow is pretty strong.

> He has no hard cc meaning he is killed easily 1v1 and in group fights

Karthus isn't meant to 1v1. He's a zone-control mage, so he controls the zone and forces teamfights the way he wants. Even if he dies in the process (as long as it's not straight away), he still has his passive in which he can nuke an entire enemy team, and his passive itself zones people away.

> He can't farm as he is always pushed out of lane by any other mid lane.

There are 2 ways to play Karthus. Either complete man-mode as seen in Jensen's video (can't link atm), or smart and safe as seen in Easyhoon's games. Karthus has a lot of bad matchups but he can still do well if you know what you're doing.
